en: The film began at 2.
You have changed a lot.
You've changed a lot.
We succeeded!
We did it!
I succeeded!
You succeeded!
He succeeded!
She succeeded!
They succeeded!
It succeeded!
We have to take him to the hospital immediately; he is seriously injured!
ko: 걔 진짜 많이 다쳤어, 당장 병원 데려가야 돼!

en: Tell me about it!
In which folder did you save the file?
Maria has long hair.
Maria's hair is long.
You don't have to come tomorrow.
It's not necessary to come tomorrow.
I have to take medicine.
I need to take medications.
Please do not take photos here.
Please don't take pictures here.
Nara is a quiet and beautiful city.
Nara is a quiet and clean city.
I'm taking a walk in a park.
My hobby is to listen to music.
My hobby is listening to music.
No matter how much I consider it I do not understand.
ko: 아무리 생각해 봐도 이해가 안 돼.

en: No matter how much I think about it, I can't understand it.
No matter how much I think about it, I don't understand it.
If you are free, give me a hand.
I work even on Sunday.
I even work on Sundays.
It happened a long time ago.
Where have you been?
It's been snowing all night.
How come you know so much about Japanese history?
ko: 일본 역사에 대해 어떻게 그렇게 잘 알아?

en: Could you turn on the light, please?
Turn right at the crossroad.
They forgot to lock the door.
He was born on July 28th, 1888.
If you will come this way...
How did your interview go?
I have to write a letter. Do you have some paper?
ko: 편지 써야 되는데 종이 좀 있어?

en: Could you do me a favour please?
She is mad at me.
I can't believe my eyes.
An eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth.
"Do you have any siblings?" "No, I'm an only child."
You are to come with me.
You have to come with me.
Are you angry at what I said?
Can you justify the use of violence?
You are a busy man, so I will adjust myself to your schedule.
ko: 넌 바쁜 사람이니까 내가 네 일정에 맞출게.

en: You are supposed to obey the law.
Can you do bookkeeping?
You have no sense of direction.
You must practice grammar.
You had better go to the infirmary.
You should know better than to ask a lady her age.
You shouldn't do things by halves.
You should pay your rent in advance.
You must keep your room clean.
You must take off your hat in the room.
You are wavering.
Have you ever climbed Mt. Fuji?
Your undaunted spirit will carry you through.
ko: 네 불굴의 정신이면 다 이겨낼 수 있을 거야.

en: You should take care of your sick mother.
You have to learn standard English.
You have bought more postage stamps than are necessary.
You are not at all wrong.
Have you ever traveled in a plane?
ko: 비행기 타고 여행해 본 적 있어?

en: I have a feeling you'll be a very good lawyer.
ko: 넌 정말 훌륭한 변호사가 될 것 같아.

en: You are idle to the bone.
Can you keep a secret?
Since you look tired, you had better take a rest.
ko: 피곤해 보이는데 좀 쉬는 게 좋겠어.

en: Now that you are tired, you'd better rest.
ko: 이제 피곤하니까 좀 쉬는 게 좋겠다.

en: You are tired, and so am I.
You are tired, aren't you?
Are you not tired?
You look tired. You ought to rest for an hour or two.
ko: 피곤해 보여. 한두 시간 정도 쉬어.

en: You are too sensitive to criticism.
You can rely on him.
You can rely on her.
You must help her, and soon!
You must not take advantage of her innocence.
ko: 그 애의 순진함을 이용하면 안 돼.

en: You should have acted on her advice.
You are treading on her corns.
ko: 너 그 애 아픈 곳을 건드리고 있어.

en: I think that you ought to apologize to her.
ko: 그 애한테 사과해야 할 것 같아.

en: You must apologize to her, and that at once.
Just a minute.
You asked after her? What did she say?
You are expecting too much of her.
ko: 그 애한테 너무 많은 걸 기대하고 있네.

en: Did you meet her?
Do you want to see her very much?
Did you fall in love with her at first sight?
You were taken in by her.
You told her that you had finished the work three days before.
ko: 너 3일 전에 일 다 끝냈다고 그 애한테 말했잖아.

en: Unlike her, you are diligent.
You are not less pretty than her.
When did you see her dancing with him?
ko: 걔가 걔랑 춤추는 거 언제 봤어?

en: You'll come to like her.
Are you aware of how much she loves you?
I think you had better call on him.
ko: 걔한테 한 번 가보는 게 좋을 것 같아.

en: You must be careful not to make him angry.
You must give him up for dead.
You needn't have seen him to the door.
You shouldn't look down on him.
You are selling him short.
You had better keep him at a respectful distance.
ko: 걔랑은 적당히 거리 두는 게 좋아.

en: You must not look upon him as great.
You're required to help them.
Are you younger than him?
All that you have to do is to wait for his reply.
You must take his age into account.
Are you for or against his idea?
You must pay attention to his advice.
You should have accepted his advice.
You may as well follow his advice.
ko: 그냥 걔 조언 따르는 게 나을 거야.

en: You may make use of his library.
All you have to do is follow his advice.
All that you have to do is to follow his advice.
You must allow for his youth.
ko: 걔가 어린 것도 좀 감안해줘야 돼.

en: You should have helped him with his work.
You should pay more attention to what he says.
ko: 걔가 하는 말에 좀 더 신경 써야 돼.

en: You must pay attention to him.
ko: 걔한테 좀 더 신경 써야 돼.

en: You should pay more attention to his warnings.
ko: 걔가 경고하는 거 좀 더 귀담아들어야 돼.

en: You ought to have adopted his plan.
You must make allowance for his lack of experience.
ko: 걔 경험 부족한 걸 좀 이해해줘야 돼.

en: It's better to ignore his eccentricities.
ko: 걔 별난 건 그냥 무시하는 게 나아.

en: You should not play on his generous nature.
ko: 걔 착한 거 이용해서 그러지 마.

en: You had better not play on his generous nature.
ko: 걔 착한 거 이용하지 않는 게 좋아.

en: You overestimate him.
You can depend on his help.
Did you accept his statement as true?
You should have told him the truth.
You must compensate him for the money he lost.
You cannot expect much of him.
ko: 걔한테 너무 많은 걸 기대하면 안 돼.

en: You should tell him the truth.
You had better tell him the truth.
You ought to ask him for advice.
It would be better for you not to ask him for advice.
ko: 걔한테 조언 안 구하는 게 나을 거야.

en: Didn't you write a letter to him?
You need only ask him to pay the debt.
ko: 걔한테 빚 갚으라고 말만 하면 돼.

en: You told him that he should have a reward.
I don't think you can gain his ear.
ko: 걔가 네 말을 들어줄 것 같지 않아.

en: You ought to thank him.
You have only to give him a little help.
You ought not to have said a thing like that to him.
You will do well to leave him.
Can you swim as fast as he?
ko: 너 걔만큼 수영 빨리 할 수 있어?

en: You had better not keep company with him.
You can trust him to keep his word.
ko: 걔는 약속 잘 지키니까 믿어도 돼.

en: Do you know who he is?
I'm certain of your success.
You should not give him up for lost.
You work as hard as he did at your age.
ko: 너 걔가 네 나이 때 그랬던 것만큼 열심히 한다.

en: Have you ever seen him swimming?
ko: 걔 수영하는 거 본 적 있어?

en: Do you think he made that mistake on purpose?
ko: 걔가 그 실수 일부러 한 것 같아?

en: What subject do you think he is interested in?
ko: 걔가 어떤 과목에 관심 있을 것 같아?

en: You should have told him about it while he was here.
ko: 걔 여기 있을 때 얘기하지 그랬어.

en: Didn't you know that he passed away two years ago?
Don't you know that he passed away two years ago?
Don't you know that he has been dead for these two years?
ko: 걔 죽은 지 2년이나 된 거 몰라?

en: You should get your hair cut.
You must be a fool.
Can you ride a horse?
You can't ride a horse.
You will progress in proportion to your abilities.
You should work hard.
You must study hard.
You don't have a temperature.
You must not come in.
Must you work on Sunday?
You don't have to go to school on Sunday.
What do you usually do on Sundays?
Are you a Japanese student?
Do you keep a diary?
Do you know how to cook meat?
You could count to ten when you were two.
ko: 너 두 살 때 열까지 셀 수 있었어.

en: You could count to ten when you were two years old.
ko: 너 두 살 때 열까지 셀 수 있었어.

en: You are not old enough to go swimming by yourself.
ko: 너 혼자 수영하러 가기엔 아직 어려.

en: You work too hard.
You are working too hard. Take it easy for a while.
ko: 너무 무리하는 거 아냐? 좀 쉬어가면서 해.

en: You can't feel at ease with a headache.
ko: 머리 아프면 편히 쉴 수가 없지.

en: You are too clever not to solve the hard problem.
ko: 넌 아주 똑똑해서 그 어려운 문제도 다 풀 수 있을 거야.

en: You know the answer?
Do you live here?
I take it for granted that you will join.
I took it for granted that you were on my side.
ko: 난 당연히 네가 내 편인 줄 알았어.

en: You don't go to school on Sunday, do you?
You had better study English thoroughly.
ko: 영어 공부 확실하게 하는 게 좋을 거야.

en: You may as well leave at once.
ko: 그냥 지금 바로 떠나는 게 낫겠어.

en: You must go home at once.
It is necessary for you to see a doctor at once.
You may as well withdraw from the club right away.
ko: 그 동아리 지금 당장 그만두는 게 낫겠어.

en: Don't you know that you are the laughingstock of the whole town?
ko: 너 온 동네 웃음거리 된 거 몰라?

en: You must be a late riser.
What do you have for breakfast?
Do you have bread for lunch?
How do you account for your being late?
You won't be late, will you?
All you have to do is apologize for being late.
You must have stayed up late.
You must be back on Sunday at the latest.
Sooner or later, you will regret your idleness.
ko: 조만간 게으름 피운 거 후회할 거야.

en: You'll learn how to do it sooner or later.
ko: 조만간 어떻게 하는지 알게 될 거야.

en: You ought to be ashamed.
You should have refused his request flatly.
Who are you waiting for?
You must build up your courage.
Whom are you speaking of?
You may invite whomever you like.
Are you meeting someone here?
Your reading is very advanced.
Can you tell wheat from barley?
You look very pale.
I'm proud of you.
You're running a big risk in trusting him.
ko: 그 사람을 믿는 건 너무 위험해.

en: What do you want to be when you grow up?
Now that you are a big boy, you may do as you please.
ko: 이제 다 컸으니까 네 마음대로 해도 돼.

en: You may take either the big box or the small one.
ko: 큰 상자든 작은 상자든 아무거나 가져가도 돼.

en: You look bored.
Do you like to be kept waiting?
All you have to do is to take care of yourself.
You may have read this book already.
You will be up against many difficulties.
You mustn't depend on others for help.
ko: 다른 사람 도움에 의지하면 안 돼.

en: You are too inquisitive about other people's affairs.
You are too critical of others' shortcomings.
Can you throw a fastball?
You depend too much on others.
You have foul breath.
You are too sensitive to noise.
You look tiny next to a sumo wrestler.
ko: 스모 선수 옆에 있으니까 진짜 작아 보인다.

en: You know quite a lot about Sumo.
You're giving me the same old line.
You look as healthy as ever.
You are to apologize to her for it.
ko: 그 일에 대해서 그 여자애한테 사과해야 해.

en: All you have to do is try your best.
You should have locked, or at least closed, all the doors.
ko: 문을 다 잠그거나, 최소한 닫기라도 했어야지.

en: You never listen. I might as well talk to the wall.
ko: 말해도 안 듣네. 벽에 대고 말하는 게 낫겠다.

en: You are a good student.
Can't you tell right from wrong?
ko: 옳고 그른 걸 구분 못 해?

en: You should distinguish between right and wrong.
ko: 옳고 그름을 구분할 줄 알아야 해.

en: You would do well to tell it to him in advance.
ko: 그 사람한테 미리 말해두는 게 좋을 거야.

en: You will have heard this story before.
You made the same mistake as last time.
Are you for the war or against it?
Do you believe war will start?
You should follow your teacher's advice.
You ought to ask for your teacher's permission.
You may as well ask for your teacher's advice.
ko: 선생님 조언을 구하는 게 나을 거야.

en: You ran a red light.
You should swear on the Bible.
You must cultivate your mind.
Can you eat raw oysters?
You are made to be a poet.
You seem an honest man.
You seem to be an honest man.
You didn't have to dress.
ko: 옷 그렇게 잘 차려입을 필요 없었는데.

en: You have to get this work finished by noon.
I should think you are right.
ko: 내 생각엔 네 말이 맞는 것 같아.

en: You may be right, but I am against your opinion.
ko: 네 말이 맞을지도 모르지만, 난 네 의견에 반대해.

en: Are you concerned with politics?
You can get ahead in the world.
He is ignorant of the world.
You will find it stated a few pages further on.
ko: 몇 페이지 더 넘겨보면 나와 있을 거야.

en: Are you fond of swimming?
You will soon get used to speaking in public.
ko: 사람들 앞에서 말하는 거 금방 익숙해질 거야.

en: You must not lose sight of your goal in life.
You were kind to help me.
Can you break away from your parents?
Do you believe in God?
If you study earnestly, you can expect to pass the exam.
ko: 열심히 공부하면 시험에 합격할 수 있을 거야.

en: It's time for you to buy a new car.
It is high time you started a new business.
ko: 이제 새로운 사업을 시작할 때가 됐어.

en: How thoughtless of you to do that.
ko: 그런 짓을 하다니 참 생각이 없구나.

en: You can rely on him. He never lets you down.
ko: 걔 믿어도 돼. 절대 실망 안 시킬 거야.

en: You must clear the table.
Do you wash your hands before meals?
I think you'd better go on a diet.
You bought the food, so if I buy the wine that will even things up.
ko: 네가 음식을 샀으니까, 내가 와인을 사면 공평하겠지.

en: You really have a passion for food.
You had better not eat too much.
ko: 너무 많이 먹지 않는 게 좋아.

en: You had better be careful not to overeat.
You must account for your neglect of duty.
ko: 네가 할 일을 소홀히 한 거에 대해 해명해야 해.

en: You are way off the track.
Are you in jest or in earnest?
You had better take a little rest.
I think you'd better take a rest; you look ill.
ko: 좀 쉬는 게 좋겠다, 너 아파 보여.

en: You're going too far.
What do you want to do in the future?
You work hard.
You are free to go out.
You have a way with women.
ko: 너 여자 마음을 참 잘 안다.

en: You are welcome to do anything you like.
ko: 네가 하고 싶은 건 뭐든 해도 좋아.

en: You should have known better than to take an examination without preparing for it.
ko: 준비도 안 하고 시험을 보다니 좀 더 신중했어야지.

en: Did you do your homework by yourself?
You are too old not to see the reason.
I take it that you are fully acquainted with the facts.
ko: 사실 관계는 다 파악하고 있는 거지?

en: You are too negligent of those around you.
You won't be in time for school.
You should give up drinking.
You should not resort to drinking.
You should give up drinking and smoking.
You ought not to have spent so much money on your hobby.
ko: 취미에 그렇게 돈을 많이 쓰는 게 아니었어.

en: You have a light hand, don't you?
Since you like to write letters, why don't you drop her a line?
ko: 편지 쓰는 거 좋아하니까 걔한테도 한 번 써 봐.

en: Are you writing a letter?
You needn't have gone to the trouble.
He looks young. He cannot be older than I.
ko: 걔 되게 젊어 보인다. 나보다 많을 리가 없어.

en: You are young. I, on the contrary, am very old.
ko: 넌 젊잖아. 난 반대로 완전 늙었고.

en: You should pay back your debts.
You should pay your debts.
You should get your car fixed.
You had better have your car washed.
You cannot be too careful when driving.
ko: 운전할 때는 아무리 조심해도 지나치지 않아.

en: You had better not drive a car.
Can you drive a car?
You can drive a car, can't you?
You don't have to make an apology.
You should apologize.
Did you actually see the accident?
Don't set your failure down to bad luck.
You should acknowledge your failure.
You must work hard in order not to fail.
You should try to form the habit of using your dictionaries.
ko: 사전을 찾아보는 습관을 들이도록 해 봐.

en: Do you know how to use a dictionary?
You should learn how to use your dictionary.
You are free to go home.
Do you have a room of your own?
You should learn to restrain yourself.
You should be true to your friends.
You should be ashamed of your ignorance.
What account can you give of your misbehavior?
ko: 네 잘못에 대해 어떻게 설명할 거야?

en: You should try to cut your way.
ko: 네 길을 스스로 개척해 나가야 해.

en: You must cut down on extra expenses in order to live within your means.
ko: 형편에 맞게 살려면 불필요한 지출을 줄여야 해.

en: You should live up to your principles.
You must share your jobs with others.
ko: 일을 다른 사람들이랑 나눠서 해야 돼.

en: You should attend to your own business.
You must account for your conduct.
You'll have to answer for your behavior.
ko: 네 행동에 책임을 져야 할 거야.

en: You are responsible for what you do.
ko: 네가 한 행동은 네가 책임져야 해.

en: You should be responsible for your actions.
You should be ashamed of your conduct.
You can't afford to neglect your health.
You are at liberty to make use of this room in any way you please.
ko: 이 방은 네가 원하는 대로 자유롭게 써도 돼.

en: You must perform your duty.
You should be more thoughtful of your safety.
You should read such books as will benefit you.
ko: 너한테 도움이 될 만한 책들을 읽어봐.

en: You are responsible for what you have done.
ko: 네가 한 일은 네가 책임져야 해.

en: You should read such books as you consider important.
ko: 네가 중요하다고 생각하는 책을 읽어야 해.

en: You yourself have to finish it.
You must do it yourself.
Are you sure of your facts?
You had better take into consideration that you are no longer young.
ko: 너도 이제 젊지 않다는 걸 고려하는 게 좋을 거야.

en: You must admit that you are in the wrong.
You should have introduced yourself.
You must control yourself.
You are the next in line for promotion.
You ought to get to work on time.
You should look after the children from time to time.
There is need for improvement in your handwriting.
You write a very good hand.
You must face the facts.
You ought to see a dentist.
You must employ your capital well.
You may as well prepare for your examination.
ko: 시험 공부 하는 게 좋을 거야.

en: You should study hard so that you can pass the examination.
ko: 시험에 합격하려면 공부 열심히 해야 해.

en: You are expected to pass the exam.
Do you take me for a fool?
You may laugh at me.
You do me wrong.
You can number me among your friends.
What on earth did you take me for?
You are the wickedest witty person I know.
ko: 너처럼 못됐는데 재치 있는 사람은 처음 봐.

en: You need not have helped my son with his homework.
ko: 우리 아들 숙제 안 도와줬어도 되는데.

en: You may use my new car.
You must do as I tell you.
You are to do as I tell you.
Are you for or against my plan?
You are welcome to the use of my yacht.
You have no claim on me.
I wish you had told me the truth.
You should have told me the truth.
You lied to me, didn't you?
I think you had better stay with us.
ko: 우리랑 같이 있는 게 좋을 것 같아.

en: You ought to have come to our party.
You insist upon our taking that course of action.
ko: 넌 우리가 꼭 그 방식대로 해야 한다고 고집하는구나.

en: You are to stay here until we come back.
All you have to do is to wait for me to return.
ko: 내가 돌아올 때까지 기다리기만 하면 돼.

en: You don't know how worried I am.
You had better do as I suggest.
ko: 내가 제안한 대로 하는 게 좋을 거야.

en: Can you imagine me making a cake?
ko: 내가 케이크 만드는 거 상상이 가?

en: You have only to follow the directions.
You must learn to obey instructions.
You finally succeeded in getting a job.
You are frustrated with your work.
You were late for work.
You should go about your business.
You'd better knuckle down to work.
Your hair wants cutting.
You had better take an umbrella with you.
ko: 우산 챙겨 가는 게 좋을 거야.

en: All you have to do is wash the dish.
Did you call me up last night?
You are guilty of murder.
You ought to have come to see me yesterday.
Did you go out last night?
You didn't come to school yesterday, did you?
You did not come to school yesterday.
Did you hear about the fire yesterday?
Why were you absent yesterday?
I advise you to be careful in making notes for the lecture.
ko: 강의 필기할 때 좀 더 신경 써서 하는 게 좋겠어.

en: All you have to do is do your best.
You should carry out his offer.
ko: 그 사람 제안대로 하는 게 좋겠어.

en: You must do your best.
You should be ready for the worst.
You work too hard these days. Aren't you tired?
ko: 요즘 일 너무 많이 하는 거 아냐? 안 피곤해?

en: You can get in touch with him at his home tonight.
ko: 오늘 밤에 걔 집으로 연락해 봐.

en: You had better not see her now.
ko: 지금은 걔 안 만나는 게 좋겠어.

en: You look happy today.
You have a little fever today, don't you?
ko: 너 오늘 열 좀 있는 것 같은데, 그치?

en: It would be better for you to stay in bed today.
ko: 오늘은 그냥 누워 있는 게 좋겠어.

en: You look pale today.
You'd better not go out today.
You must not go out today.
You had better not see her today.
ko: 오늘은 걔 안 만나는 게 좋겠어.

en: You look very charming today.
You ought to be on time if you start now.
ko: 지금 출발하면 제시간에 갈 수 있을 거야.

en: It is necessary for you to start now.
You worked a lot this week.
ko: 너 이번 주에 일 진짜 많이 했다.

en: You need not have a haircut this week.
ko: 이번 주엔 머리 안 잘라도 되겠어.

en: You're coming with us now.
ko: 너 지금 우리랑 같이 가는 거야.

en: What are you about now?
You will need much more money than you do now.
ko: 지금보다 돈이 훨씬 더 많이 필요할걸.

en: Have you ever seen a kangaroo?
Can you get by on your wages?
You'd better start now.
It is necessary that you start at once.
Are you a senior high school student?
You were careless in your action.
You had better go.
You are old enough to behave yourself.
ko: 너도 이제 네 행동에 책임질 나이잖아.

en: It is necessary for you to go.
You may go or stay at will.
You don't have to go to the party unless you want to.
ko: 가기 싫으면 파티 안 가도 돼.

en: You have to go.
It's necessary for you to go.
You'd better not go.
You should make your ideas correspond with reality.
You will see a forest of masts in the harbor.
Are you happy?
You are really full of curiosity, aren't you?
You are free to do as you please with your money.
ko: 네 돈이니까 네 마음대로 해도 돼.

en: You've got to learn to hold your tongue.
ko: 입 좀 조심하는 법을 배워야 해.

en: You must do as you are told to do.
It was careless of you to lose the key.
ko: 열쇠를 잃어버리다니 너 정말 칠칠치 못하구나.

en: You made a wise choice.
You did an excellent job.
Didn't you see a dog pass through the yard?
ko: 마당으로 개가 지나가는 거 못 봤어?

en: You had better give up smoking for your health.
ko: 건강을 위해서 담배는 끊는 게 좋겠어.

en: You have to turn in the reports on Monday.
You had better leave there on Monday.
How many times a month do you write home?
ko: 한 달에 몇 번이나 집에 편지 써?

en: You should do the honorable thing and resign.
You must make up your mind, and that at once.
You have to account for your absence.
How do you account for your absence?
You're off in your reckoning.
You had better call off your plan.
You must go through with your plan.
You should advocate disarmament.
You are the master of your own destiny.
You must judge for yourself.
You need to have friends who can help you out.
ko: 널 도와줄 수 있는 친구들이 필요해.

en: What do you base your theory on?
You do your part and I'll do the rest.
ko: 넌 네 할 일 해, 나머지는 내가 할게.

en: You must live up to your principles.
You should pay attention to your well-being.
ko: 네 건강에 신경 좀 써야 해.

en: You are wearing your socks inside out.
You need not take off your shoes.
I suppose you're hungry.
You needn't have hurried to the airport.
Do you ever dream about flying through the sky?
ko: 하늘을 나는 꿈을 꾼 적 있어?

en: Have you ever been to Kyushu?
You must come back before nine o'clock.
You can get a loan from a bank.
You should make an effort to stop smoking.
You had better not smoke while on duty.
ko: 근무 중에는 담배 안 피우는 게 좋겠어.

en: You've left out a word in copying the textbook.
ko: 교과서 베껴 쓰다가 단어 하나 빼먹었어.

en: Are you trying to fish in troubled waters?
I think you had better take a rest.
You have no need to hurry.
You need not have hurried.
You needn't have hurried; you've arrived too early.
ko: 서두를 필요 없었는데 너무 일찍 왔네.

en: You'd better hurry up.
Do you know who Rie Miyazawa is?
Where are you going to spend the vacation?
You are in need of a holiday.
You must go up the hill.
You must form regular habits.
You broke the rule.
You must act in accordance with the rules.
You should conform to the rules.
Did you inform your friends of your home-coming?
Clear up your desk a bit.
You had better make the most of your opportunities.
ko: 기회를 최대한 잘 활용하는 게 좋아.

en: You're stepping into dangerous territory.
ko: 너 지금 위험한 짓 하고 있는 거야.

en: You must know you're faced with a crisis.
ko: 너 지금 위기라는 걸 알아야 돼.

en: You look pale.
You look pale. You had better lie down in bed at once.
ko: 너 안색이 안 좋아. 당장 가서 좀 누워 있어.

en: You are as white as a sheet.
I think that you're wrong.
ko: 내 생각엔 네가 틀린 것 같아.

en: Have you ever read any Chinese poems?
You've done a perfect job.
You are nothing but a student.
You must not be absent from school.
You may be late for school.
What subjects are you taking at school?
He is, indeed, a man of his word.
ko: 그는 정말 약속을 잘 지키는 사람이야.

en: Indeed you know a lot of things, but you're not good at teaching them.
ko: 아는 건 참 많은데, 가르치는 건 잘 못하네.

en: You seem to be prejudiced against ideas that come from foreign countries.
ko: 너 외국에서 온 생각들에 편견이 있는 것 같아.

en: Would you like to go abroad?
Do you plan to go abroad?
You should have attended the meeting.
You are not entitled to attend the meeting.
You don't have proper dignity as chief of the section.
You like fruit.
You must be mindful of your family responsibilities.
You did not need to have your house painted.
Will you stay at home?
You will stay at home.
What grade are you in?
You continue making the same mistakes time after time.
You may go anywhere.
What time are you going on duty?
What time will you get to the station?
You're too suspicious about everything.
How many books do you have?
What are you looking for?
What are you looking at?
What do you learn?
What do you intend to do?
You have put everything out of order.
What are you going to be?
What do you want to be?
What will you have?
What are you going to have?
You will have your own way.
What woke you up?
You want to have a finger in every pie, don't you?
ko: 너 여기저기 참견 안 하는 데가 없네, 그치?

en: What did you come here so early for?
You've worked hard for months and have certainly earned a holiday.
ko: 몇 달 동안 고생 많았으니까 당연히 휴가 갈 자격 있지.

en: Please let me know what you want.
I wonder if you have something to write with.
What do you like?
You seem to be thinking of something else.
Do you belong to any clubs?
Do you love music?
You really have an ear for music.
ko: 너 진짜 음악 들을 줄 아는구나.

en: You are not a coward.
You dropped your pencil.
Do you have any pencils?
First, you have to stop smoking.
It is necessary for you to stop smoking.
Are you not able to speak English?
Do you study English?
All you have to do is try hard to master English.
ko: 영어 마스터하려면 열심히 노력하기만 하면 돼.

en: Did you try to review the English lessons?
Can you make yourself understood in English?
You can't speak English, can you?
He asked me if I could speak English.
ko: 걔가 나한테 영어 할 줄 아냐고 물어봤어.

en: You can speak English well, can you not?
You can swim, can't you?
Can you swim?
You can't swim, can you?
I think you'll have very little difficulty in getting a driver's license.
ko: 운전면허 따는 거 별로 안 어렵겠는데?

en: You're still too young to get a driver's license.
ko: 운전면허 따기엔 넌 아직 너무 어려.

en: You're in luck. The plane is on time.
You are tallest.
You must not tell a lie.
What are you driving at?
ko: 대체 무슨 말을 하고 싶은 거야?

en: Did you read it at all?
You have only to study hard, and you will pass the test.
ko: 공부만 열심히 하면 시험 합격할 거야.

en: You have only to study hard.
Being a teacher, you must learn to keep a tight rein on your emotions.
ko: 선생님이니까 감정 조절하는 법을 배워야 해.

en: You'll never be alone.
You should follow the doctor's advice.
You'd better consult the doctor.
You had better ask the doctor for advice.
ko: 의사 선생님한테 조언을 구해보는 게 좋겠어.

en: You are strong-minded.
I'm surprised that you're so naïve.
You've done it!
Do you remember seeing me before?
ko: 전에 우리 본 적 있는 거 기억나?

en: You must conquer your fear of the dark.
You should return home before it gets dark.
ko: 더 어두워지기 전에 집에 가야 해.

en: You are in a safe place.
You may rest assured; I have no ulterior motive in making this donation.
ko: 안심해도 돼. 이 기부에는 아무런 딴 마음도 없으니까.

en: You must rid yourself of bad habits.
You've set a bad example.
Did you break the window on purpose or by accident?
ko: 창문 일부러 깬 거야, 실수로 깬 거야?

en: How many days will you remain in London?
You must make up for the loss.
Don't you like apples?
You had better put on a raincoat.
You don't like love stories.
If you studied hard, you would get good marks.
ko: 공부 열심히 하면 성적 잘 나올 텐데.

en: You worked hard, or you would have failed.
ko: 열심히 해서 다행이지, 안 그랬으면 떨어졌을 거야.

en: You are too ready to speak ill of others.
ko: 넌 남 험담을 너무 쉽게 해.

en: How dare you speak to me like that?
ko: 감히 나한테 어떻게 그렇게 말할 수 있어?

en: How dare you speak like that?
You have a good chance to get well.
How dare you say that?
You're really a hard worker.
You have a good sense of humor.
Have you ever seen a UFO?
You are no longer a mere child.
ko: 너 이제 더 이상 어린애가 아니야.

en: You must take things as they are.
You should act more calmly.
It would be better for you to read more books.
ko: 책을 좀 더 읽는 게 좋겠어.

en: You must study more.
You should have known better.
You should know better.
You are old enough to know better.
You should study harder.
You must study much harder.
ko: 공부 훨씬 더 열심히 해야 해.

en: All you have to do is to work harder.
ko: 넌 더 열심히 하기만 하면 돼.

en: You should be more careful.
You should take better care of yourself.
It is regrettable that you did not start earlier.
You should have come home before.
You should have completed it long ago.
You should eat more, or you won't get well soon.
ko: 더 많이 먹어야 해, 안 그러면 금방 안 나아.

en: You had better speak more naturally.
ko: 좀 더 자연스럽게 말하는 게 좋겠어.

en: You'd better try to assert yourself more.
ko: 네 주장을 좀 더 확실히 하는 게 좋겠어.

en: You should have been more careful with your health.
You ought to have been more careful.
You need to study harder.
You should have worked harder.
I think it necessary for you to study harder.
ko: 너 공부 더 열심히 해야 할 것 같아.

en: You should have been more careful.
You belong in a better place than this.
ko: 넌 여기보다 더 좋은 곳에 어울려.

en: You should have come earlier.
Do you like Mozart's music?
Have you taken your medicine yet?
Have you solved all the problems yet?
It's high time you had a haircut.
ko: 너 이제 머리 자를 때 됐다.

en: You are old enough to stand on your own feet.
Now that you're grown up, you must not behave like that.
ko: 이제 다 컸으니까 그렇게 행동하면 안 돼.

en: Now that you are grown-up, you ought to know better.
ko: 이제 다 컸으니까 철 좀 들어야지.

en: Now that you are grown up, you must not behave like a child.
ko: 이제 다 컸으니까 어린애처럼 굴면 안 돼.

en: You are now an adult.
Now that you have come of age, you should know better.
ko: 이제 성인이 됐으니까 철 좀 들어야지.

en: Now that you have come of age, you should be responsible for what you do.
ko: 이제 성인이 됐으니까 네 행동에 책임을 져야 해.

en: Now you've come of age, you have the right to vote.
You must go to bed now.
You had better go to bed now.
You should have come a little earlier.
You must get up a little earlier.
You nearly poked me in the eye with your pencil.
You must be less impatient.
You had better stay here a little longer.
ko: 여기 좀 더 있는 게 좋겠어.

en: Have you finished doing your homework yet?
Have you done all your homework?
Now that you have passed your test, you can drive on your own.
ko: 이제 시험 합격했으니까 혼자 운전해도 돼.

en: You are not a child any more.
You may go home now.
It is time you went to school.
Have you turned in your report?
It's high time you got going.
Have you finished reading that book yet?
Have you finished the work yet?
You are old enough to know this.
If you read this book again, you will have read it three times.
ko: 이 책 한 번 더 읽으면 세 번 읽는 거야.

en: Now that you are eighteen, you can get a driver's license.
ko: 이제 열여덟 살이니까 운전면허 딸 수 있어.

en: You are now old enough to support yourself.
You surprised everybody.
You've been properly led up the garden path.
You look as if it were none of your business.
You look as though nothing has happened to you.
You haven't changed at all.
You have made the very same mistake again.
Are you still smarting over my remarks?
You haven't washed your hands yet, have you?
You're not old enough to get a driver's license.
ko: 넌 아직 운전면허 딸 나이가 아니야.

en: Have you got a pen?
You will not take Bob's advice.
ko: 넌 밥의 조언을 안 들을 거잖아.

en: Are you planning on staying long in Berlin?
Can you speak French?
You can't speak French, can you?
You neglected to tell me to buy bread.
ko: 빵 사 오라고 말하는 걸 깜빡했네.

en: You failed to wake Harry up.
You'd better go by bus.
You must put an end to your foolish behavior.
ko: 그런 바보 같은 행동은 이제 그만해.

en: You should practice playing the violin every day.
It appears that you have made a foolish mistake.
ko: 너 바보 같은 실수를 한 것 같아.

en: You have to go to the party.
You say Nessie is an imaginary being, but I think she exists.
ko: 너는 네시가 상상 속의 존재라고 하지만, 난 있다고 생각해.

en: You'll have to manufacture some kind of excuse.
I tried to reach you on the phone, but I was unable to get through.
What a man you are!
How tall you are!
How kind you are!
How rude of you!
How lucky you are!
You're such a cute boy.
Do you want anything?
Why can't you come?
Why did you try to run away?
Why did you not go to the office?
Why do you accuse my son?
Why did you absent yourself from class yesterday?
What prevented you from coming earlier?
ko: 무슨 일 때문에 더 일찍 못 왔어?

en: Why do you want to study abroad?
Why do you want to buy this book?
What do you need the money for?
Why did you use up all the money?
What a good thing you say!
You must consider what kind of work you want to do.
ko: 어떤 일을 하고 싶은지 생각해봐야 해.

en: How long have you been in Japan?
How often do you go abroad?
How long will you stay here?
You can always count on Tom.
You're a friend of Tom's, eh?
How do you get to school?
Which club do you belong to?
How high can you jump?
How tall are you?
You are very brave.
You look very tired.
That's very sweet of you.
Which bed do you want to use?
It's about time you got here!
Which one do you take?
Which of your parents do you take after?
You may go anywhere you like.
ko: 가고 싶은 곳은 어디든 가도 돼.

en: Wherever you go, you'll be welcomed.
Which college are you aiming for?
Where do you attend high school?
Where were you?
Do you feel at home anywhere?
How did you obtain these old postage stamps?
How about you?
How did you come to know her?
Why don't you try to take your money back?
What has made you decide to work for our company?
How did you come up with such a good excuse?
Why did you say such a thing?
What have you come here for?
What has brought you here?
You don't know German, do you?
Do you not play tennis?
You'd better go home as soon as possible.
ko: 최대한 빨리 집에 가는 게 좋겠어.

en: You don't like chocolate, do you?
You have just done your homework.
You should make sure of the fact without hesitation.
ko: 망설이지 말고 사실을 확인해 봐야 해.

en: You have been imposed upon.
You smoke far too much. You should cut back.
ko: 너 담배 너무 많이 피워. 좀 줄여야겠어.

en: You've been had.
You should give up smoking.
You must give up smoking.
It is best that you stop smoking.
You should give up smoking and drinking.
ko: 너 술 담배 다 끊어야 해.

en: All you have to do is to obey my orders.
ko: 넌 그냥 내 말만 들으면 돼.

en: All you have to do is wait for his arrival.
ko: 그 사람 올 때까지 기다리기만 하면 돼.

en: All you have to do is to wait.
All you have to do is to join us.
All you have to do is wash the dishes.
You are to start at once.
You needn't have taken a taxi.
You have only to touch the button.
You have many books.
You are very fortunate that you have such friends.
ko: 그런 친구들이 있다니 넌 정말 운이 좋다.

en: Are you able to type?
You must not rely upon such a man.
You may think those shoes are in fashion, but they aren't.
ko: 그 신발 유행인 것 같지? 사실 아니야.

en: You had better not repeat such an error.
ko: 그런 실수 다시는 안 하는 게 좋을 거야.

en: You must not depend so much on others.
You need not have hurried so much.
You need not have come here so early.
You don't need to worry about such a thing.
ko: 그런 건 걱정 안 해도 돼.

en: You shouldn't do such a thing.
You are old enough to know better than to act like that.
ko: 너 나이가 몇인데 그런 짓을 해.

en: You are not to do that.
It is impossible for you to do so.
You ought not to have done such a thing.
You shouldn't have done such a thing.
You may as well keep it a secret.
You can bank on that.
Who did you give it to?
You could have done it.
Were you to take it back?
Have you finished it?
Do you have one?
You can see it, but you cannot take it away.
ko: 볼 수는 있는데 가져가면 안 돼.

en: You will wish you had never seen it.
ko: 차라리 안 봤으면 좋았을 거라고 생각하게 될 거야.

en: You must practice it at regular intervals.
Did you buy it on the black market?
You should have done it earlier. It cannot be helped now.
ko: 진작 하지 그랬어. 이제 어쩔 수 없지 뭐.

en: What did you open it with?
You shouldn't have done it.
You ought not to have done that.
You needn't do it at once.
You must do it at once.
When did you finish it?
You have to cope with those difficult problems.
ko: 그 어려운 문제들을 잘 해결해야 돼.

en: You're going about it in the wrong way.
Are you in favor of the workers getting more money?
ko: 노동자들이 돈 더 받는 거 찬성해?

en: You will not be able to catch the train.
Do you know the reason?
You have to judge the case without bias.
Could you solve the problem?
You should have introduced yourself to the girl.
You must return the book to him.
You need not have bought the book.
You may keep the book.
You will not be able to go through the book so quickly.
ko: 그 책 그렇게 빨리 다 못 읽을걸.

en: Are you for or against the bill?
You ought to know better at your age.
You ought to have seen the exhibition.
Are you in favor of or against that policy?
You should apply for that post.
Do you know where the girl lives?
Have you finished reading the novel?
You make too much of the event.
ko: 그 일을 너무 과하게 생각하는 거 아냐?

en: Are you sure about the cost of that car?
You should emphasize that fact.
You need not take account of the fact.
ko: 그 사실은 고려 안 해도 돼.

en: How do you account for the fact?
You must state the fact as it is.
You have no business complaining about the matter.
ko: 그 일에 대해 불평할 자격 없어.

en: Did you watch the game?
Did you cut the paper?
You must look after the child.
ko: 그 애 좀 잘 봐줘야 해.

en: You may as well do the task now.
Will you take on the job?
You have to overcome the difficulties.
You have a responsibility to explain that behavior to me.
ko: 그 행동에 대해 나한테 설명할 책임이 있어.

en: You owe me an apology for that.
You have to account for the result.
You must inform your superior of the results.
You should abide by the consequences.
You are responsible for the result.
You should carry out the plan on schedule.
Are you for or against the plan?
You shouldn't have eaten the fish raw.
Did you ever see the fish?
You have to raise funds for the relief work.
ko: 구호 활동을 위해 기금을 모아야 해.

en: Are you planning to take part in the meeting?
Can you make out the meaning easily?
You'll have some difficulty in carrying out the plan.
ko: 그 계획 실행하기 좀 힘들 거야.

en: Are you in favor of the plan or not?
You must get rid of that bad habit.
ko: 그 나쁜 버릇 꼭 고쳐야 돼.

en: You must promise not to take the rope off.
You must be above such mean conduct.
Did you ever hear the like of it?
You look smart in the shirt.
Did you tape that concert?
Dare you ask him about it?
ko: 너 걔한테 그걸 물어볼 배짱은 있어?

en: You are sure to succeed in time.
ko: 시간이 지나면 넌 분명히 성공할 거야.

en: You'd better not go there.
You may go there.
Do you deny that you went there?
All you have to do is to meet her there.
ko: 넌 거기서 그녀를 만나기만 하면 돼.

en: You may as well say so.
You should have done so.
You will be delayed for only thirty minutes at worst.
You had better make a clean breast of everything.
You're wet through.
You aren't a spy, are you?
I hear that you've been ill.
You should have told me a long time ago.
You've got a lot of guts.
You'd better have your hair cut at once.
ko: 당장 머리 좀 자르는 게 좋겠어.

en: You may as well go to bed at once.
You may go at once.
You'd better set off at once.
You'll get well soon.
You've got it in one. That's right.
You will soon get accustomed to living here.
It is necessary for you to start at once.
You had better start at once.
You will soon be convinced I am right.
ko: 곧 내 말이 맞다는 걸 알게 될 거야.

en: You may as well begin at once.
You will soon get accustomed to your new school.
You are to give up smoking at once.
You are to do it at once.
You will soon come to like this town.
ko: 곧 이 동네가 마음에 들 거야.

en: You'd better go to see your family doctor at once.
You ought to do it at once.
You may as well wash your shirt.
You're forever making mistakes.
You can stay with us for the time being.
What are you staring at?
You will soon regret your rash conduct.
ko: 너 곧 그 경솔한 행동을 후회하게 될 거야.

en: You must adapt to a variety of conditions.
You may have mistaken Jane for his sister.
ko: 네가 제인을 걔 여동생으로 착각했나 보다.

en: You'd better stay at home rather than go out on such a day.
ko: 이런 날엔 나가는 것보다 집에 있는 게 낫겠어.

en: You must put an end to this foolish behavior.
ko: 이런 바보 같은 짓은 이제 그만해.

en: You are fortunate for having such good friends.
Did you do this on your own?
You have to put up with all these noises.
I hope you can come up with a better plan than this.
ko: 이것보다 더 좋은 계획을 생각해냈으면 좋겠어.

en: You must put these mistakes right.
Have you read this book already?
Have you read this book yet?
You have only to read a few pages of this book.
ko: 이 책 몇 페이지만 읽으면 돼.

en: You are not to leave this room.
Do you know what this box is made of?
You have to put up with all this noise.
Where did you go last Sunday?
Can you swim across the river?
All you have to do is sign this paper.
You must get this homework finished by the day after tomorrow.
ko: 모레까지 이 숙제 다 끝내야 해.

en: You are not excused from the responsibility for this serious situation.
ko: 이 심각한 상황에 대한 책임에서 벗어날 수 없어.

en: You will come to like this kind of music.
You can use this car.
You are asking too much for this car.
ko: 이 차 가격 너무 비싸게 부르는 거 아냐?

en: Since you have nothing to do with this matter, you don't have to worry.
ko: 넌 이 일이랑 상관없으니까 걱정 안 해도 돼.

en: You are old enough to understand this.
Can you make sense of this poem?
You are suitable for the job.
You'll have this composition written by noon tomorrow, won't you?
ko: 내일 정오까지 이 작문 다 쓸 거지?

en: This ticket entitles you to a free meal.
ko: 이 티켓 있으면 공짜로 밥 먹을 수 있어.

en: You have no choice in this matter.
You should not think little of this result.
You had better avail yourself of this opportunity.
ko: 이번 기회를 꼭 잡는 게 좋을 거야.

en: You should make use of this chance.
Can you read this kanji?
You'll soon get accustomed to this cold weather.
ko: 이 추운 날씨에 곧 적응될 거야.

en: Can you get at the meaning of this passage?
You'll find yourself in deep water if you continue to live beyond your means.
ko: 분수에 넘치게 계속 살면 나중에 큰일 날 거야.

en: It is important for you to keep this secret.
You should take advantage of this chance.
You are deeply involved with this.
How did you come by this money?
You have only to come here.
You have only to sign your name here.
All you have to do is sign your name here.
You have only to sit here.
You are safe so long as you stay here.
You had far better stay here.
You are to stay here.
You are secure from danger here.
You can study here.
You have only to wait here for him.
ko: 여기서 그 사람 기다리기만 하면 돼.

en: You'd better not wait here.
Are you going to sing here?
You are prohibited from smoking here.
What ever are you doing here?
How long did it take you to drive from here to Tokyo?
You had better get away from here at once.
ko: 지금 당장 여기서 나가는 게 좋을 거야.

en: You've drunk three cups of coffee.
Have you had any experience with this kind of work?
You have to study hard to catch up with your class.
ko: 수업 진도 따라가려면 공부 열심히 해야 해.

en: You must be mentally exhausted.
You'll certainly pass the coming exam.
Not only you but also I was involved.
Where are you from in Canada?
You will catch cold.
Since you have a cold, you must not go out.
ko: 감기 걸렸으니까 밖에 나가면 안 돼.

en: You ought to have taken your father's advice.
You ought to take your father's advice.
You may as well follow your father's advice.
ko: 아버지 조언을 따르는 게 나을 거야.

en: Have you visited the town where your father was born?
You should ask your father for his advice and follow it.
You should apologize to Dad for not coming home in time for supper.
ko: 저녁 시간 맞춰서 안 온 거 아빠한테 사과해.

en: Have you ever visited the office where your father works?
You don't get up as early as your sister.
You look just like your big brother.
You haven't any money.
Haven't you got any money?
Aren't you happy?
You have done very well.
You are, so to speak, a fish out of water.
ko: 넌 말하자면 물 밖에 나온 물고기 신세야.

en: You are now among the elite.
When did you come to Japan?
When will you leave here?
You are at liberty to leave any time.
When will you be free?
When did you begin studying English?
You are always as busy as a bee.
ko: 넌 항상 눈코 뜰 새 없이 바쁘네.

en: You're always criticizing me!
You always like to trip me up, don't you?
ko: 넌 항상 내 꼬투리 잡더라, 그렇지?

en: You're always finding fault with me.
You always take things too easy.
You are always complaining.
You are always wearing a loud necktie.
You are always the cause of my worries.
You're always anticipating trouble.
You always excuse your faults by blaming others.
ko: 넌 항상 남 탓하며 네 잘못을 변명해.

en: You always insist that you are in the right.
You are always doubting my word.
You are always finding fault with me.
You always talk back to me, don't you?
What time do you usually get up?
What time do you usually go to bed?
You are always watching TV.
You are watching TV all the time.
